You've gotta be real fucking intelligent to be at the top in football, I'll tell you that. They may not be super wise, but they're not trying to be, and the rapid thinking, creativity and decision-making is really impressive of most footballers.

Doesn't that still make him intelligent though? I mean it's not like he's just seeing stuff and passing with his feet. His subconcious mind is constantly doing multiple calculations that someone with an average mind couldn't do. I'm pretty sure that genius doesn't only apply to his football. It's not really that impressive to become a business guru, brilliant mathematician or a great engineer compared to what #214;zil's doing. I think most people, if they try hard enough, can become those things. Most people that are imo considered intelligent, are trying really hard to be.

He's definitely doing calculations, and very very qucikly. Almost in an instant. For example, measuring the weight of his passes at the same time as having to know where the player he passes to is going to be, and he always does it perfectly. I don't see how his minds capacity doesn't apply to other things than just football. I'm sure that if he'd choosen another career that involves subconcious thinking, he'd be a genius at that too.
That St Totteringhams day must be coming up really soon then

It's just a gif man. And saying Alexis does these things "few times every game" is pretty fucking over-the-top too.

No, I genuinely thought you weren't serious because I couldn't make any sense of your comment, and when you tried to explain I had to point out that it's just a gif and it's nothing to get angry about. Ever since we bought #214;zil he's been a starter and we're now close to our 2nd FA-cup title in a row. He starts week in week out. Do you think Arsene just says "yeah, fuck it, let's play him even though he's been shit". If you can't see what #214;zil does for the team I suggest you look closer. In this gif he created a chance that very few players in the world are capable of, that's what #214;zil does, and you say "Whenever he does something cool (like the gif in the OP) he fails to actually deliver a final ball" when it clearly looked like walcott should've got on the end of it. You even go on about "his shooting is absolutely dire" when he barely even shoots. That's delusional to me.

You can't talk about #214;zil without making it sound downgraded just because he doesn't score a lot of goals by himself, but when he does a neat play some Alexis super fan comes in and says #214;zil is over praised. His task is to drift around the pitch and pass the ball into areas and he does it perfectly and I can't make it sound much more glorified. That's just how it is.

He's not a regular nr10, he doesn't nearly have that much attacking authority. He's much like Iniesta right now who's work also goes quite unnoticed. Sure, #214;zil hasn't been spectacular, but I personally think he was worth the 45 mil. Yeah, thanks.
